card1.title: Cyberpunk
card1.blurb: Cyberpunk RED by R. Talsorian Games, set {0} into the future. A group of edgerunners are recruited by their fixer to fulfill corporate contracts for conspiracies larger than they could imagine.

card2.title: The Waking Rune
card2.sub: "In the Varisian Gulf near Magnimar, a Runecarved Key was found with nothing in history explaining what it was or did."
card2.blurb: Season 4 of the Pathfinder Society Roleplaying Guild campaign is referred to as the Year of the Risen Rune due to the season's prominent presence in Varisia and activities dealing with the mystic civilizations ruled by ancient wizard kings, or Runelords, that were lost to time.

card3.title: Spheres of Power
card3.blurb: A Skybourne-inspired Spheres of Power campaign. Airships are the primary form of travel between disconnected civilizations, requiring a crew of sailors to man and protect from hazardous weather and flying monsters. Spheres of Power provides versatile character building options, along with Spheres of War for martials.

card1.title: Plex
card1.blurb: Free Plex accounts can share media libraries between devices or to friends, and access Plex's content library of ad-supported video on demand and free-to-stream live TV channels.
card1.blurb2: If you already have your own account, you can request to have our library shared with you.

card2.title: Jellyfin
card2.blurb: Jellyfin is a free and open source media server. It is a fork of Emby, written in C#. Compared to Plex, it does not have centralized authentication, meaning all user accounts must be locally registered, and content libraries cannot be shared across servers.

card1.title: Discord
card1.blurb: Discord is a proprietary freeware VoIP application and digital distribution platform designed for video gaming communities, that specializes in text, image, video and audio communication between users in a chat channel.
card1.blurb2: {0} is our hub for chatting and playing games. We keep text channels organized by topic, use threads for discussing individual games, and have regularly populated voice channels for playing together.

card2.title: Mastodon
card2.blurb: Mastodon is a free, open-source social network server. Users can interact with each other by posting text, images, and videos, and can follow other users' posts. Users create their accounts on "instances", which are separate servers running Mastodon.
card2.blurb2: We use a fork of Mastodon called Glitch-soc, which adds a few features compatible with the ActivityPub protocol.
